image.altText: Glenn Maxwell plays a shot against England at the Champions Trophy.

props.synopsis: Cricket Australia "postponed" its 2021 Test match with Afghanistan over concerns about the Taliban's human rights abuses against women, and did not play in the subsequent 2023 or 2024 series, but says it will fulfil its ICC Champions Trophy tournament obligations.

title.children: Australian cricket team play Afghanistan despite boycotting other matches

image.altText: a girl holds a puppy

props.synopsis: Year Six student, Anais Betts, from the Central Coast, suffered a critical injury when she was hit by a falling tree branch during an excursion.

title.children: Student injured on excursion remains in critical condition more than a week on

image.altText: A close up shot of David Pocock speaking with the blurred media members in the foreground

props.synopsis: David Pocock claimed an historic victory in 2022, helping the typically predictable Canberra region attract more attention than usual in the federal election. This time around, there are other issues that deserve a closer look.

title.children: Strong Labor city faces independent challenge in federal election

image.altText: A man smiles for the camera

props.synopsis: It was a case of mistaken identity which led to the tragic death of Canberra man Glenn Walewicz at his front door. The woman who organised it is now facing sentencing.

title.children: Prosecutors want substanial jail term for Canberra murder mastermind

image.altText: an old man gets out of a car

props.synopsis: John Vincent Roberts, 83, will serve at least one year of his prison sentence in jail, after pleading guilty to three counts of indecent assault against one of his students.

title.children: 'Predatory' Christian Brother sentenced for historic child sex abuse

image.altText: Young girl holding an exceptionally large apple, 1930

props.synopsis: The National Library's latest exhibition, Fit to Print: Defining Moments from the Fairfax Photo Archive, comprises around 150 photographs that illustrate moments in Australian history from the 1890s until the late 1940s.

title.children: New exhibition 'traces the birth of photojournalism in this country'

image.altText: A man with very short dark hair in a white button up shirt sits n a flooded balcony looks serious.

props.synopsis: Thomas Ockenfels bought his Canberra apartment more than two years ago, and then realised water was prone to seeping into his bedroom when it rained. His attempts to get his strata company to address the issue have cast light on a growing issue.

title.children: Though rain leaks into his unit, Thomas says his strata doesn't help

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A Canberra doctor facing 20 charges including rape and assault committed against four young women has been suspended from practising in Australia.

title.children: Canberra doctor charged with sexual assault suspended from practising

image.altText: school sign

props.synopsis: Brindabella Christian College is facing further scrutiny as it battles financial and governance challenges.

title.children: Union takes Canberra private school to Fair Work Commission over unpaid wages and superannuation

image.altText: Independent MPs stand in a group at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The current crossbench is making no promises to guarantee support to either Labor or Coalition in a hung parliament — with nearly all saying they would force a minority government to deal with them bill by bill, and retain their right to withdraw support.

title.children: Crossbenchers say hung parliament would have to negotiate bill by bill

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskiy walking next to Donald Trump, who is talking with his hands outstretched

props.synopsis: Donald Trump wants to "recoup" US aid money sent to help Ukraine defend itself against Russian invaders, while Volodymyr Zelenskyy wants security assurances for his country.

title.children: Trump and Zelenskyy are meeting over a minerals deal. It could be tense

image.altText: A yellow sand beach with blue water on a sunny day, dotted with lots of people on the sand sunbaking.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology's latest three-month outlook issued indicates a mean temperature more than 1.5C above pre-industrial levels for most of Australia.

title.children: Spring and summer collectively warmest on record as heat spell continues

image.altText: Brendan Lang in front of an air-conditioning unit

props.synopsis: Analysis by international think tank InfluenceMap has looked at how the gas industry has pushed back against efforts in Victoria to transition away from gas as part of a global campaign to keep households hooked on the fuel.

title.children: The gas lobby has a ‘playbook’ on how to keep you hooked on gas

image.altText: The International Space Station flying above Earth.

props.synopsis: US researchers have created the first 3D map of the microbes on the International Space Station, finding a lack of microbial diversity could be causing astronauts to get rashes, cold sores and other immune issues.

title.children: The ISS is 'too clean', and it could be making astronauts sick

image.altText: A woman with tied back brown hair in a green and yellow soccer kit has arms outstretched

props.synopsis: For the first time ever, the Matildas, Young Matildas and Junior Matildas are all without a permanent manager. It's a worrying sign for Australian football, writes Pokuah Frimpong.

title.children: Coach-less and directionless Matildas falling further behind rivals

image.altText: A group of Antarctic expeditioners stand on snow-covered ground

props.synopsis: An abandoned Australian base in Antarctica has undergone an initial clean-up after a French inspection team last year raised concerns hazardous waste at the site posed an environmental risk.

title.children: Australia begins cleaning up its abandoned Antarctic base after French inspection

image.altText: Man listening to reporters' question, Australian flag behind him

props.synopsis: The defence minister has once again stressed that China did not breach international law by conducting live-fire drills off the coast of Australia, after the Coalition slammed the government's response to the episode.

title.children: Deputy PM calls for calm as Chinese warships enter Great Australian Bight

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaking

props.synopsis: There were no shortage of ministers falling over themselves to get in front of cameras and microphones, eager to point out the list of questions they had for would-be prime minister Peter Dutton.

title.children: A tip truck of Dutton dirt reversed into the press gallery this week

image.altText: Senator Fatima Payman stands in front of a media pack in Parliament House to announce she's quitting the Labor Party

props.synopsis: The independent senator said the controversial comments were not her own opinions but representative of the personal experiences that women at the event shared with her.

title.children: Payman apologises for saying Iran is a place where women's 'voices are heard'

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: An older gentleman with grey facial hair and a blue collared shirt stands in a kitchen with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: What are the key issues on your mind this federal election? We want to know.

title.children: 'Struggling to breathe': Cost of living top of mind for voters as federal election looms

image.altText: Single quantum computing chip

props.synopsis: Amazon has released a prototype quantum chip called Ocelot, which the company says could be used to create a powerful quantum computer using less resources than its competitors.

title.children: Amazon unveils quantum chip with solution to 'eye-watering' error problem

image.altText: actor gene hackman and his wife arrive to the golden globes in 2003

props.synopsis: American actor Gene Hackman, 95, and his wife Betsy Arakawa have been found dead in their home in the US state of New Mexico.

title.children: Actor Gene Hackman and wife found dead in their New Mexico home

image.altText: An illustration of a measles particle.

props.synopsis: The Victorian health department says two cases of measles were detected at multiple locations in Melbourne and Bendigo over the past week.

title.children: Exposure sites in Melbourne and Bendigo listed for two measles cases

image.altText: Putin sits at a table with a smirk on his face

props.synopsis: South Korea's spy agency says it is working to determine how many soldiers from Kim Jong Un's regime are being moved into Russia.

title.children: North Korea sending more troops to Russia as Putin praises US talks

image.altText: A man wearing a face mask sits next to an iPhone 16 advertisement

props.synopsis: It's one of the largest companies in the world. That didn't stop the Indonesian government from banning Apple's iPhone 16 and gaining enormous investment pledges.

title.children: Indonesia made iPhones a forbidden fruit — and triumphed over Apple

image.altText: Elon Musk opens a black jacket to reveal a t-shirt that says "tech support".

props.synopsis: Elon Musk makes a star appearance at Donald Trump's first cabinet meeting, winning praise from the president for his controversial work as cost-cutting czar.

title.children: Musk's 'tech support', other moments at first Trump cabinet meeting

image.altText: A man is held in an emotional embrace by an older woman and man

props.synopsis: The group had been held in Thailand for a decade and the move came after several assurances from senior officials that they would not be deported.

title.children: Deportation of Uyghurs to China 'a death sentence in plain sight'

image.altText: A woman with dark hair wearing a blue dress

props.synopsis: Lawyers for journalist Antoinette Lattouf delivered their closing submissions in the unlawful termination case against the national broadcaster on Thursday.

title.children: 'Activist' claim proof Lattouf was sacked because of opinions, court told

image.altText: A white and red passenger ship moored in a bay in an industrial area.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian premier has refused to rule out the state's newly built Spirit of Tasmania ferry being used to house Ukrainian refugees in Scotland.

title.children: Premier won't rule out Ukraine refugees on Spirit of Tasmania ferry

image.altText: A close-up of Trachtenberg with her dark hair in loose waves and wearing heavy eyeliner

props.synopsis: The New York Medical Examiner is investigating the death of actor Michelle Trachtenberg, who was found unresponsive in her Manhattan apartment.

title.children: What we know about Michelle Trachtenberg's death

image.altText: A small cart exits a large tunnel in the an alpine national park

props.synopsis: Underground work has stopped on the Snowy 2.0 project and a safety review is underway after a ventilation fan imploded at the site earlier this week.

title.children: 'Miracle' no-one hurt as Snowy 2.0 fan implosion sends metal flying

image.altText: Man in suit speaking behind microphone

props.synopsis: Austria's three top centrist parties in parliament have reached a deal to form a coalition government without the far-right Freedom Party.

title.children: Austria gets new coalition government without far-right election winner

image.altText: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy listens during a news conference.

props.synopsis: Busy Ukrainian officials are working tirelessly to secure a lasting peace deal and end the war with Russia, but not all agree on the latest approach from the US and Donald Trump.

title.children: Ukraine's war room fears a ceasefire could be a 'Russian trap'

image.altText: A woman sits on a bench looking out to sea.

props.synopsis: Her fake psychologist was found out, fired and three months later, did it all again.

title.children: Melbourne woman convicted for holding fake 'psychology sessions'
